required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Sarecycline Truncal Acne Safety and Efficacy Response
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Center, Phase 4, Open-label Prospective Case Series Study of the Safety and Efficacy of Sarecycline for 12 Weeks in Subjects Ages 9 and Over With Truncal Acne

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy and safety of oral sarecycline 1.5 mg/kg/day in truncal acne. Patients with moderate to severe acne vulgaris will be observed over a period of 12 weeks. Lesion counts, investigator's global assessments, photography, and safety measures will be assessed for the trunk and face.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Acne Severity Based on Investigator's Global Assessment Success
primary_outcome.description: Investigator's Global Assessment (IGA) success for truncal acne vulgaris at week 12

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Absolute Lesion Count
primary_outcome.description: Absolute change from baseline lesion counts for inflammatory acne for truncal acne vulgaris at week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: Adverse Events and Adverse Events of Special Interest
secondary_outcome.description: Safety based on adverse events (AEs), adverse events of special interest (AESI), vital signs, and physical examinations

arm_group.description: Eligible patients will be prescribed with commercially available sarecycline at a dosage of 1.5 mg/kg/day and followed for 12 weeks post initiation of treatment.

intervention.description: 60 mg sarecycline tablets will be given for subjects with a body weight of 33 to 54 kg, 100 mg sarecycline tablets will be given for subjects with a body weight of 55 to 84 kg, and 150 mg tablets will be given for subjects with a body weight between 85 and 136 kg.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with moderate to severe truncal acne at a single center in Texas, USA.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female age 9 or above.
- Clinical diagnosis of moderate to severe truncal acne based on IGA
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected allergies or sensitivities to any components of the study drug.
- Any disorders that would preclude the use of tetracycline-class antibiotics or sarecycline.
- Any uncontrolled or serious disease, or any medical or surgical condition, that may either interfere with the interpretation of the trial results and/or put the subject at significant risk (according to the Investigator's judgment) if the subject takes part in the trial.
Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.
